turn.0: ELI5: Why do bugs like to buzz around people's heads, even when being constantly swatted at?
turn.1: The whole "why do bugs do what they do" question has been answered many times. It basically boils down to the fact that they (the majority of them) don't have the mental capacity to either plan ahead or remember what they just did 5 seconds ago. It's auto pilot instinct.
turn.2: Bugs such as bees have plotted routes to and from sources of pollen, etc., so there has to be more of a capacity for memory/planning than that.  Even if there isn't, if would explain the seemingly random movements of their flight patterns at times (for some bugs), but it doesn't explain their insistence on buzzing in circles around your face until you escape the area or swat it away.
turn.3: Well, I just told you. They do it because they're homing in on you but they don't have the brains to know that you just swatted them a second ago. They're only goal is to dodge the current swat.
